Yashaswi Institute of
Skill Development

  • About

ABOUT YISD

As new industries take shape to meet the evolving needs of mankind, there is a growing need for a workforce with different skill sets. Pharma, Hospitality, Food & Food Processing, Retail and Logistics, are just some of those sectors, where the need for this skilled workforce is fast growing.

To cater to these fields that have an immense potential to generate employment and to give the underprivileged youth a new platform to pursue their ambitions, Yashaswi Group started the Yashaswi Institute of Skill Development.

Similar in its philosophy to YIT, Yashaswi Institute of Skill Development (YISD) aims to train the youth in specific skill sets to cater to specific manpower needs in the above-mentioned sectors.

Learn and Earn

YISD has launched a skill development scheme that has been recognised as the Best Skill Development Initiative in India by the National Skill Development Corporation. Called the Learn & Earn Scheme (similar to the Learn & Earn run by YIT), it is affiliated to Maharashtra State Board of Technical Education.

Students who qualify certain eligibility criteria are given on-the-job training with a specific industry partner. While students are paid stipends, at the end of the training module, the industry gets skilled professionals for the Food & Food Processing, Pharma, Logistics and Hospitality segments.

In 2010, the Government of Maharashtra approved Learn & Earn as India’s first skilling scheme initiated by a private institute.

Benefits of the Indusrty

  • Skilled technicians can be developed as per the industry requirements and its own work culture.
  • To have longevity in retaining on roll operatives/trainee (up to 4 years).
  • Skilled technicians can be developed as per the industry requirements and its own work culture.
  • To have longevity in retaining on roll operatives/trainee (up to 4 years).
  • Skilled technicians can be developed as per the industry requirements and its own work culture.

    • Eligibility Crieteria for students

  • Qualification :   Min. SSC (Pass). HSC, ITI, MCVC (Pass or Failed)
  • Age :                 18 to 26 years
  • Written Test :    Min 50% Passing
  • Interview :        Conducted by concerned organization.

    • Selection and training Procedure

  • YIT and industry will jointly select SSC/HSC/ITI/MCVC students through well designed selection process.
  • Selected students are deputed to the concerned organization(s) for on the job training.
  • Students will work in industry as per the shift duties scheduled by the respective industry for eight hours.
  • Students will undergo for the class room training inside the factory premises.
  • Students will undergo for the practical training in AICTE approved Poly Technique College on weekly off.

    • Role of the industry for on the job training

  • To impart on the job training to the students under Learn & Earn scheme.
  • To pay minimum stipend of K 7000/- & K 8000/- respectively for Non ITI & ITI students with increases of K 500/- per year.
  • To provide Insurance Coverage, Uniform & Shoes. Canteen & Transport facility along with all the education cost of the student.

    • COURSES OFFERED BY YISD (AFFILIATED TO MAHARASHTRA STATE BOARD OF TECHNICAL EDUCATION)

  • Diploma in Industrial Drug Science
  • Diploma in Food Service
  • Diploma in Retail Management
  • Diploma in Supply chain & Logistic Management
  • Diploma in Hospitality Management

    • Our Clients

    Recognitions

    Shaikshanik Bhushan Award 2010 for YIT

    With the approval of Learn & Earn scheme by the Government of Maharashtra, the Annasaheb Magar Foundation recognised and celebrated YIT’s contribution to education at the State Level. The Shaikshanik Bhushan Award for the year 2010, was bestowed upon the institute.

    Indian Leadership Award for Excellence in Education 2013

    For his immense contribution to the field of education and skill development, Shri. Vishwesh Kulkarni was awarded the prestigious Indian Leadership Award for Excellence in Education for the year 2013. The award was conferred upon him by Shri Bhishma Narayan Singh, former Governor & Cabinet Minister in a glittering ceremony organised by All India Achievers Foundation at India Habitat Centre, New Delhi.

    Recognising YIT’s contribution to Make in Maharahstra at Yashotsav Pimpri 2015

    Yashotsav, a convocation of sorts that celebrated the completion of training of students at YIT. The event saw the students getting their certificates at the hands of Shri. Amar Sable, Member of Parliament. Shri. Sable also pointed out Yashaswi Group’s extensive participation in skill development across Maharashtra, which he said had played a crucial role in strengthening industries in Maharashtra.

    Celebrating the legacy of YIT at Yashtosav Pune 2015

    The Learn & Earn Scheme of YIT earned special words of appreciation from Shri. Gautam Chabukswar, Member of Legislative Assembly, Maharashtra at the felicitation ceremony of the latest batch of pass-outs of the YIT Learn & earn Scheme. The best performing students were given gold medals and certificates in the presence of dignitaries.

    Unveiling Yashogatha at Yashtosav Aurangabad 2015

    When the nation is focused on skill development, the work done by Yashaswi Group continues to inspire everyone. These were the words of Shri. Sameer Kulkarni, Managing Director, Bajaj Auto, at the unveiling of Yashogatha, a memoir of the legacy of YIT at Yashotsav Aurangabad.
